Experience YouTube Ads Policy and Partner Operations Specialist - Germany and Turkey Google February 2014  – Present (1 year 7 months) Dublin, Ireland - Analyze data, identify gaps in the policy framework and determine the effectiveness of current respectively potential policies. 
- Liaise with engineering teams to provide solutions to technical problems and liaise with policy and legal teams to craft solutions to emerging threats. 
- Provide regional expertise and language support on time sensitive policy issues. 
- Enforce edge case YouTube policy guidelines on escalations from our global enforcement teams. 
- Determine eligibility of users, channels and videos for YouTube’s Partner Program and enforce YouTube’s Copyright policies and Terms of Service. 
- Handle applications from the Turkish market for YouTube’s Partner Program.  
- Educate partners on the type of content they can upload and monetize on YouTube. 
- Troubleshoot and resolve critical partner queries concerning the monetization process, copyright, community guideline policies and AdSense. 
- Suggest improvements to internal policy tools, policies, procedures, and products. Online Marketing Executive Vectone September 2013  –  February 2014  (6 months) London, United Kingdom - Manage and run Online Marketing Campaigns optimizing its effectiveness and preparing regular campaign performance reports. 
- Constant overview of the campaign-related parameters on campaigns’ CPA/CPL/Cost/Sales etc. 
- Ensure the marketing material (Web, LP, banners, Print) is correct and up to date. 
- Verify the daily sales figures on analytics/CRM/internal report to ensure consistency. 
- Maintain a complete overview of the trends in all the campaigns in Google/FB accounts at all times. 
- In charge of the entire content on the website, ensuring correct translation of all content in local language. 
- Research on alternative online promotion opportunities. 
- Work with web team in maintaining and updating the Website, SEO tags and online optimization. 
- Create and execute email campaigns. 
- Secure key off and online media spaces working with media buying team on contracts. 
- Take complete ownership of all communications in German. Visual Merchandiser - Team Lead Abercrombie & Fitch July 2011  –  September 2013  (2 years 3 months) London, United Kingdom - Evaluate market conditions and formulate marketing strategies based on knowledge of established objectives and market characteristics. 
- Promote competitive activities while adhering to allocated budget. 
- Project management: direct and coordinate marketing activities and policies to promote products. 
- Ensure adherence of corporate and brand standard operating procedures. 
- Ensure alignment of operations within annual financial budgets in terms of sales, profitability, costs and inventory on a day to day basis. 
- Handle input and output of new stock, lay out check backs and create analysis reports to the home office in the US. Research and Marketing Assistant eDeal Association January 2013  –  March 2013  (3 months) - Daily deal market research in various countries (Europe and Turkey). 
- Contact daily deal providers and build up a strong collaboration. 
- Assist the Marketing Manager with the organization and management of the conference and expo. Research Analyst (Internship) JWG June 2012  –  October 2012  (5 months) - Research and data analysis in the field of financial regulation and its impact on institutions within the banking and IT sector; formulate implementation strategies. 
- Management and organization of meetings and conferences, for instance the FIMA DACH event (September 2012). 
- Responsible for the written and telephone correspondence with institutions and members based in Germany. Sales Consultant ACCESSORIZE October 2009  –  August 2010  (11 months) - Manage sales to achieve branch sales target; monitor ROI. 
- Implement marketing strategies to meet the organizations’ objectives; identify new business opportunities. 
- Serve as an interface between customers and owners to escalate firsthand feedback and cascade the core business strategy. 
- Responsible for inventory management ensuring adequate quantities and cycle of selling stocks whilst controlling the ageing, shrinkage and damages. Summary Xinyan Zhang is an international illustrator currently located in San Francisco. She mostly works with watercolor and acrylic media, but is also open to other media. Her specialties are book illustrations and children's books. She is very self-motivated and goal oriented. Also being creative and dedicated, with strong, clear, concise and detailed process work, she makes sure to communicate thoroughly to avoid miscommunication and answer to the needs of clients as much as possible. She is open-minded to critiques and great at problem solving, and also work well both individually as well as in groups.
